action.action-desc: Ms. Van Duyne introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the disposition of a firearm to, and the possession of a firearm by, an adult who, while a juvenile who had attained 15 years of age but not 18 years of age, committed an offense that would have been a felony if committed by an adult.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Disarming Felons Act.

section.header: Prohibition on disposition of firearm to, and possession of firearm by, an adult who, while a juvenile who had attained 15 years of age but not 18 years of age, committed an offense that would have been a felony if committed by an adult

subsection.text: Section 922(d) of title 18, United States Code, is amended in the 1st sentence—

paragraph.text: by striking or at the end of paragraph (10);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (11) and inserting ; or; and
by inserting after paragraph (11) the following:
while a juvenile who had attained 15 years of age but not 18 years of age, committed an act of juvenile delinquency that would have been a felony if committed by an adult.

subsection.text: Section 922(g) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking or at the end of paragraph (8)(C)(ii);
by striking the comma at the end of paragraph (9) and inserting ; or; and
by inserting after paragraph (9) the following:
who, while a juvenile who had attained 15 years of age but not 18 years of age, committed an act of juvenile delinquency that would have been a felony if committed by an adult,
